questions.q: Which of these is an example of a safe/good touch?
options: A high-five from a teacher after doing well in a test.
Someone touching your private parts.
Someone you don't know hugging you tightly.
questions.correct: A high-five from a teacher after doing well in a test.

questions.q: Which parts of your body are considered private and should not be touched by others without your permission (except for necessary reasons like a doctor with a parent present)?
options: Arms and Legs.
Mouth, chest, between the legs, and bottom.
Head and Shoulders.
questions.correct: Mouth, chest, between the legs, and bottom.

questions.q: What is a common way to know if a touch is unsafe/bad?
options: The person gives you a gift afterwards.
It makes you feel confused, scared, uncomfortable, or wrong.
The touch is done in a public place.
questions.correct: It makes you feel confused, scared, uncomfortable, or wrong.

questions.q: If someone tells you to keep a secret about something that makes you uncomfortable, what should you do?
options: Keep the secret so you don't make them angry.
Tell a trusted adult right away, even if the person said not to.
Tell the person you will keep the secret but tell all your friends.
questions.correct: Tell a trusted adult right away, even if the person said not to.

questions.q: Who are the trusted adults you can talk to about unsafe touches?
options: Only strangers who offer help.
Parents/Guardians, Grandparents, Older Siblings, School Teachers, or other family members you feel safe with.
Only the person who is giving the unsafe touch.
questions.correct: Parents/Guardians, Grandparents, Older Siblings, School Teachers, or other family members you feel safe with.

questions.q: Have you ever been asked by an adult to do something that felt wrong or confusing?
options: Yes, and it made me feel uncomfortable.
No, everything always feels right.
Only if it was one of my friends.
questions.correct: Yes, and it made me feel uncomfortable.

questions.q: Has anyone ever shown you pictures or videos that are private or sexual and told you not to tell anyone?
options: Yes, but it was just a joke, so it's okay.
No, never.
Yes, and it made me feel uneasy.
questions.correct: Yes, and it made me feel uneasy.

questions.q: Have you ever been threatened or made to feel bad if you didn't agree to do what an adult was asking?
options: Yes, and I felt scared.
No, adults never threaten me.
Yes, but they were just playing, so it was fine.

questions.q: If someone gives you a gift or money and asks you to keep a secret about a touch, how does that make the situation feel?
options: It makes the secret safe and worth keeping.
It makes the touch feel more like an unsafe/bad touch because they are trying to hide it.
It means the person is just being kind.
questions.correct: It makes the touch feel more like an unsafe/bad touch because they are trying to hide it.

questions.q: Have you ever seen someone else (another child) being touched or treated in a way that made them look scared or uncomfortable?
options: No, I haven't noticed.
Yes, and I knew it was wrong.
Yes, but it's not my business to worry about.
questions.correct: Yes, and I knew it was wrong.

questions.q: What is the National Child Helpline Number that you can call for help and support?
Who is the most important person to tell immediately if you have been subjected to an unsafe touch or activity?
options: The person who did the activity.
A trusted adult like a parent, guardian, or teacher.
Your pet.
questions.correct: A trusted adult like a parent, guardian, or teacher.

questions.q: According to the POCSO Act, if a teacher, doctor, or any adult knows that a child is being abused, are they legally required to report it to the authorities?
options: No, it's optional and depends on the child's feelings.
Yes, they have a mandatory duty to report it to the police or authorities.
Only if the child gives them permission.
questions.correct: Yes, they have a mandatory duty to report it to the police or authorities.

questions.q: If you can't tell your parents, which official authority should a trusted adult (like a school principal) report the crime to?
options: The Fire Department.
The local police or the Special Juvenile Police Unit (SJPU).
The bank manager.
questions.correct: The local police or the Special Juvenile Police Unit (SJPU).

questions.q: What is the most important thing to remember after reporting an unsafe activity?
options: You must never talk about it again.
It is not your fault, and you did the right thing by telling someone.
You will be in trouble for making a fuss.
questions.correct: It is not your fault, and you did the right thing by telling someone.
